Sys::DbugUart Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for Sys::DbugUart:

Documentation

This class uses Dbug and Uart classes to create a concrete debugging class. The following is an example of how to use the debugger:

DbugUart d(0); //use UART port 0 for debugging
d.init(); //initialize the UART (only do this ONCE for all instances)
d.setmode(Dbug::DECIMAL, 8); //decimal mode with 8 leading zeros
d << "My number in DECIMAL " << 1123 << "\n";
d.setmode(Dbug::BINARY, 8); //decimal mode with 8 leading zeros
d << "My number in BINARY " << 1123 << "\n";

Member Function Documentation

int Sys::DbugUart::close ( void  )
virtual

See details below.

This method closes the peripheral. Once a single instance closes the peripheral, no other instances will be able to access it.

Reimplemented from Hal::Periph.
